basics.name: Jolie Ching
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2022.

work.company: Laboratory of Advanced Visualization and Applications (LAVA Lab)
highlights: Developing a virtual reality visualization of Moloka’i based on Hawaiian cartography in collaboration with the LAVA Lab and Honors Program Director Vernadette Gonzalez and Masters Candidate in Computer Science, Kari Noe
Demoed and presented prototypes at various conferences.

work.company: UH Manoa Ka Leo O Hawai'i
highlights: Head of online presence for Ka Leo
Maintain, update, and oversee official college newspaper website
Refine and develop site’s user experience and interface with BLOX CMS

work.company: Native Hawaiian Science and Engineering Mentorship Program
highlights: Developing a responsive WordPress application through WAMP to increase awareness of Native Hawaiian academic programs
Manage AISES finance and budget, create funding proposals and presentations

work.company: American Indian Science and Engineering Society
highlights: Create funding proposals and presentations for indigenous educational and outreach events
Keep track of organizational budget and ledger
Review, research, and advise Board on changes to terms and conditions of Campus Center Board Charter, bylaws, policies, and procedures
A competition for college students to design, build, and fly a high-powered rocket.
Lead simulations designer for testing of accuracy of rocket flight path via OpenRocket and MissileWorks Data Acquisition and Configuration (mDAQ)

awards.title: Manoa Regents Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to top 20 incoming freshmen who receive an SAT score of at least 1340, maintain at least a 3.5 GPA in high school, and whose extracurricular achievements are shown to be remarkable.

awards.title: Undergraduate Research Opportunities Grant
awards.summary: Project Title: Designing a Virtual Reality Visualization of Hawaiian Geographical Elements

awards.title: Ku a Kukui Professional Development Grant
awards.summary: Funded He Au Honua conference trip and trips to Keawanui, Moloka’i for Honors thesis project

conferences.title: Lahui Hawai'i Research Center Student Conference
conferences.summary: Ching, J., Noe, K. (2018, Nov.), Digitizing Detours: Developing a Virtual Reality Visualization of Native Hawaiian Place Knowledge. 30-minute presentation at the Lahui Hawai’i Research Center Student Conference, University of Hawai’i at Manoa, Hawai’i.

conferences.title: American Indian Science and Engineering Society
conferences.summary: Ching, J. (2019, Oct.), Developing a Virtual Reality Visualization of Native Hawaiian Place Knowledge. 2-hour poster presentation at the American Indian Science and Engineering Society National Conference, Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

conferences.title: American Studies Association National Conference
conferences.summary: Ching, J., Noe, K. (2019, Nov.), Digitizing Detours: Developing a Virtual Reality Visualization of Native Hawaiian Place Knowledge. 3-hour live demo at the American Studies Association National Conference, Honolulu, Hawai’i.

conferences.title: Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program Conference
conferences.summary: Ching, J. (2019, Dec.), Developing a Virtual Reality Visualization of Native Hawaiian Place Knowledge. Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program Conference, University of Hawai’i at Manoa, Hawai’i.
